intro: Alseis, commonly known as the ironwood tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the western United States and parts of Mexico, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Alseis species are known for their hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Their ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
